tourName: Watersports and whale watching holiday, South Africa
generalInfo:
Welcome to Southern Africa!

Embark on a captivating 9-day journey through the scenic wonders and vibrant culture of Cape Town and its picturesque surroundings. Starting with two nights in the dynamic city of Cape Town, you'll experience a seamless blend of urban excitement and breathtaking natural beauty. Enjoy thrilling water activities, including a sunset catamaran cruise with views of Table Mountain and kitesurfing along the famed beaches.

As you venture beyond the city, spend one night in Milnerton, followed by another in Muizenberg, indulging in the rich culinary landscape with dinners at renowned local restaurants and picturesque wineries. An overnight sailing trip offers a serene escape on the waters where the Atlantic and Indian Oceans meet, showcasing the region's stunning marine life and starlit skies.

Continue your exploration with one night in Simonstown, where you'll encounter historic charms and natural splendor, and then two nights in De Kelders, immersing yourself in marine safaris and quaint coastal experiences. Each location offers unique activities and restful evenings in carefully chosen accommodations, ensuring your journey is as relaxing as it is adventurous.

As your trip concludes, reflect on a diverse tapestry of experiences that perfectly blend adrenaline, tranquility, and cultural immersion against the stunning backdrop of Cape Town’s diverse landscapes. This tour promises an unforgettable mix of excitement and serenity, tailored to showcase the best of South Africa’s coastal allure.

On your last day, you'll fly home , filled with unforgettable memories and a newfound appreciation for the adventurous spirit that is Africa !

dayInfo.description: Sunset Sails and Starlit Tales Welcome to your first day in Cape Town, a city steeped in history and bursting with natural beauty. Your journey begins with a seamless airport pick-up by Hannival's Tours, promptly at the time of your arrival. As you leave the bustling airport behind, you'll be whisked away to your accommodation in one of the city's serene neighbourhoods. Parker Cottage, where you'll be staying for the next two nights, isn't just any guest house. Built in 1895 by the influential John Parker, first mayor of Greater Cape Town, this historic building has been lovingly preserved and updated. The decor combines antique elegance with contemporary comforts, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Each of the ten luxurious en-suite rooms boasts unique character, outfitted with modern amenities while respecting the building's historic charm. The cottage operates sustainably, maintaining off-grid systems for water, electricity, and climate control, and holds a Fair Trade Accreditation. After settling into your room, the evening promises a spectacular start with a 1.5-hour sunset catamaran cruise. Departing from the picturesque V&A Waterfront, Luxury Yacht Charters offers a tranquil escape on the waters. The Atlantic Ocean at sunset provides a breathtaking backdrop as you glide past landmarks like Table Mountain and Robben Island, illuminated in the soft evening light. As night falls, we suggest dining at Willoughby & Co. located within the vibrant V&A Waterfront. Known for its fresh seafood and sushi, Willoughby's offers an authentic taste of Cape Town's culinary excellence. The atmosphere here is lively yet unpretentious, making it a favorite among locals and visitors alike. Returning to Parker Cottage for the night, you'll find peace and privacy in your luxury room, a perfect end to an invigorating day in Cape Town. The personal touch of the guest house, coupled with its rich history and commitment to sustainability, makes it an ideal place to unwind and reflect on the day's adventures. Meal Inclusions: None

Seas the Day ... Whales, Seals, and Culinary Feasts ! The second day of your Cape Town adventure begins bright and early, as Hannival's Tours arrives at Parker Cottage to provide transport for the day's excursions. The first stop on your itinerary is an exhilarating Ocean Safari with Ocean Wonder, departing from Granger Bay at 09:00 AM. This two-hour tour offers a chance to see the marine diversity of the Atlantic seaboard up close. From majestic whales and playful dolphins to the myriads of seabird species, this safari is a thrilling way to experience Cape Town's abundant sea life in its natural habitat. Following the ocean safari, lunch awaits at the exquisite Chef's Warehouse @ Tintswalo Atlantic. Nestled at the base of Chapman's Peak, Tintswalo offers not just delectable cuisine but also breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean. The restaurant is famed for its sophisticated atmosphere and impeccably crafted dishes, providing a tranquil setting to relax and savour the flavors of local and international gourmet fare. The adventure continues in the afternoon with Seal Snorkelling in Hout Bay from 13:30 to 16:00. This unique experience allows you to swim alongside Cape fur seals in their natural environment. The playful and curious nature of these marine mammals makes for an unforgettable and intimate wildlife encounter, all under the guidance of expert snorkelling guides who ensure a safe and respectful experience in the water. For dinner, we recommend Miller's Thumb, a cozy eatery known for its eclectic decor and warm ambiance. Specializing in seafood and various international dishes, Miller's Thumb makes each meal a memorable event with its vibrant flavors and friendly service. It's the perfect spot to wind down after a day full of aquatic adventures. Your second night concludes back at Parker Cottage. Reflect on the day’s rich experiences as you settle in for another peaceful night's sleep. Meal Inclusions: Breakfast Only

Wind-Washed Wonders and Culinary Delights Your morning begins at 9:00 AM with Hannival's Tours picking you up from Bliss Boutique and transporting you to the beach where your adventure with Open Ocean Africa kicks off. Here, you’ll engage in a kitesurfing session designed for beginners. The experienced instructors will guide you through the basics of harnessing the wind and waves, offering a thrilling introduction to this dynamic sport. Cape Town's renowned winds and beautiful coastline provide the perfect playground for this exhilarating activity. After your kitesurfing experience, you'll be ready to refuel with a delightful lunch at Happy Folks from 12:00 PM to 2:00 PM. This restaurant is known for its vibrant atmosphere and health-focused, delicious meals that cater to all palates. Enjoy a leisurely meal in a cheerful setting where the food is as wholesome as the smiles around you. At 2:00 PM, the adventure continues with a beginner windsurfing lesson from Windsurfing Cape Town, led by the experienced Katja. This session offers you a chance to glide across the water, learning the techniques required to manoeuvre and balance on the windsurf board. Set against the stunning backdrop of Cape Town's beaches, it's an ideal way to enjoy the natural beauty of the area while picking up a new skill. As the sun begins to set, prepare for an exquisite dining experience at Jéan Restaurant, located at the Klein Roosboom Boutique Winery. Dinner at Jéan is not just a meal, but an event. Nestled in a picturesque setting with cozy dining nooks inside converted concrete wine tanks, the restaurant serves dishes that are a testament to culinary artistry, made from locally sourced ingredients and paired with top-tier wines produced on-site. Your day concludes with a stay at Bliss Boutique Hotel in Milnerton. This one-night stay in a Superior Deluxe Queen room offers serene luxury and stunning views of the ocean and Table Mountain. The hotel combines contemporary elegance with personalized service, ensuring a restful night after a day full of adventure and exploration. Meal Inclusions: Breakfast Only

Feathers, Peaks, and Beach Breaks Your day begins at 9:00 AM with Hannival's Tours providing transport to your first destination, SANCCOB (South African Foundation for the Conservation of Coastal Birds). This visit offers a rare glimpse into the vital work of seabird rehabilitation. At SANCOB, you'll see firsthand how rescued penguins and other seabirds are cared for and prepared for release back into the wild—a deeply inspiring start to your day. Following your inspiring visit to SANCOB, you'll embark on a Peninsula Tour from 10:30 AM to 3:00 PM. This tour takes you through some of the Cape's most picturesque landscapes, including the breathtaking Chapman's Peak Drive, the charming harbour of Hout Bay, the lush vineyards of Constantia, and the dramatic cliffs of Cape Point Nature Reserve. Each stop offers stunning views and a chance to experience the diverse beauty of the Cape Peninsula. Lunch will be at The Commons in Muizenberg, a popular spot known for its vibrant atmosphere and delicious, sustainably sourced cuisine. Enjoy a relaxed meal here, which is a perfect midday pause during your tour. At 3:30 PM, get ready to hit the waves with a 90-minute surfing lesson at Surfshack Surf School. This session includes board and wetsuit hire, and whether you're a beginner or just brushing up on your skills, the experienced instructors at Surf Shack will ensure you have a great time riding the waves of Muizenberg's famous surf spots. Dinner is planned at Bang K, a culinary gem known for its bold flavors and unique dishes. Enjoy an evening filled with delightful tastes in a chic and casual setting, perfect for reflecting on the day's adventures. The day concludes with an overnight stay in a Cube Apartment at Bella eV in Muizenberg. This self-catering accommodation offers modern amenities and sleek design, providing a comfortable and stylish base as you unwind from a busy day of exploration and excitement. Meal Inclusions: Self-Catering

Maritime Bliss and the Cape's Two Oceans The fifth day of your holiday offers a relaxed morning in the coastal town of Muizenberg, known for its laid-back vibes and colourful beachfront. Enjoy a leisurely start to your day, exploring the local cafés or simply soaking up the serene beach atmosphere. Transport for the day is provided by Hannival's Tours, ready to take you to your next culinary stop. Lunch is at Bertha's in Simonstown, a charming seaside restaurant known for its fresh seafood and picturesque views of the harbour. It’s a perfect spot to enjoy the local flavors and watch the bustling activity of this naval town. Post-lunch, embark on a memorable journey with Cape Town Yacht Charters for an overnight sailing trip around the stunning Cape Peninsula. This excursion offers a unique opportunity to see the meeting point of the Atlantic and Indian Oceans from the deck of a yacht, possibly spotting marine life such as seals, dolphins, and even whales. Dinner will be served on board, allowing you to enjoy a delightful meal under the open sky. Experience the tranquil beauty of the ocean at dusk, dining to the gentle lapping of waves and a backdrop of the sun setting over the sea. Your night will be spent aboard the yacht, where you can retire to the gentle sway of the sea, under a blanket of stars. This overnight sailing trip not only promises breathtaking views and serene moments but also an intimate experience of the ocean’s nighttime splendour. Meal Inclusions: Breakfast & Dinner

Underwater Whispers and Seaside Dining Begin Day 6 with another exhilarating adventure, this time delving into the depths of the ocean. After being picked up by Hannival's Tours, your day starts with a Freediving Shore Trip led by Shamier Moegmat of Apnea Addicts. Experience the serene world beneath the waves as you learn the basics of freediving in the clear, cool waters off Cape Town's coast. This session offers a blend of challenge and tranquillity, providing a unique opportunity to connect with marine life and explore underwater landscapes without the encumbrance of scuba gear. Following your underwater exploration, unwind with dinner at Harbour House in Kalk Bay. Situated right on the rocks, this restaurant offers spectacular ocean views and is renowned for its fresh seafood and elegant atmosphere. Enjoy the sound of waves crashing against the shore as you dine, making for a perfect end to an adventurous day. Conclude your day at Moonglow Guesthouse in Simonstown, where you will stay in a Queen room with a balcony. Moonglow is ideally positioned on the mountainside, providing panoramic views of False Bay. The room's balcony is the perfect spot to relax and take in the scenic vista, reflecting on the day's underwater journey and anticipating the adventures yet to come. Meal Inclusions: Breakfast Only

Whales, Waves, and Wonders of the Wild Your seventh day in Cape Town starts early, with transport provided by Hannival's Tours whisking you away to a Big 5 Marine Safari adventure with Marine Dynamics. From 7:00 AM to noon, immerse yourself in a spectacular wildlife expedition that offers close encounters with the marine life of the South African coast. This part of the ocean is teeming with biodiversity, including sharks, seals, and, depending on the season, the majestic Southern Right Whale. The knowledgeable guides from Marine Dynamics will enrich your experience with insights into the lives of these incredible creatures. After your morning on the water, enjoy a well-deserved lunch at Rosemary’s Country Kitchen in Gansbaai. This charming eatery is known for its cozy ambiance and delicious, hearty meals prepared with local ingredients, providing a warm welcome after your ocean adventure. Post-lunch, we suggest continuing your exploration of the natural beauty of the area with a hike to the historic KlipGat Caves. Located in the Walker Bay Nature Reserve, these caves are not only a site of significant archaeological interest but also offer stunning views of the coastline and the ocean beyond. For dinner, head to Kuslangs, a local favorite that boasts a relaxed seaside setting and a menu that highlights the best of coastal cuisine. Enjoy the casual, friendly atmosphere as you dine with the sound of the waves providing a soothing backdrop. End your day at Whalesong Lodge in De Kelders, where you will stay overnight in a room that combines comfort with breathtaking views. Positioned on the cliffs above Walker Bay, Whalesong Lodge is the perfect spot to watch the sunset and perhaps catch a glimpse of whales in the distance, offering a peaceful and picturesque end to a day filled with natural encounters. Meal Inclusions: Breakfast Only

Paddles, Pinot, and Picturesque Paths Kickstart your eighth day with an invigorating sea kayaking session with Walker Bay Adventures from 8:00 to 10:00 AM. Paddle through the calm waters of Walker Bay, where you might spot dolphins, seals, and during whale season, the awe-inspiring Southern Right Whales. This guided adventure not only offers a unique vantage point to view marine life but also allows you to experience the tranquility of the ocean up close. Following your morning on the water, refuel with lunch at The Wine Glass in Hermanus. This sophisticated restaurant is celebrated for its extensive selection of local wines paired perfectly with gourmet dishes that showcase the region's best produce and seafood. The relaxed yet refined atmosphere makes it an ideal spot for a leisurely lunch. The afternoon is yours to explore Hermanus on foot. This charming coastal town is famous for its natural beauty and friendly locals. Stroll through the streets, visit local shops and art galleries, or relax by the seaside, soaking in the laid-back vibe of the town. For dinner, head to the Blue Goose, a quaint restaurant known for its warm ambiance and excellent cuisine. Specializing in fresh seafood and traditional South African dishes, the Blue Goose offers a delightful culinary experience in a cozy setting. Conclude your day back at Whalesong Lodge, where another night in comfort awaits. Spend the evening relaxing on your balcony or by the fireside, enjoying the serene environment and the stunning ocean views that make Whalesong Lodge a perfect retreat. Meal Inclusions: Breakfast Only

Homeward Bound On your final day, you'll begin with a comfortable transfer back to Cape Town from De Kelders, provided by Hannival's Tours. This drive offers you a last chance to reflect on the unforgettable experiences and scenic beauty of your South African adventure as you journey back to the city. Upon arrival in Cape Town, you will proceed to the airport where you will board your flight home. This departure marks not just the end of your trip but the beginning of carrying these memories and stories with you, as you return from the vibrant landscapes of Cape Town to the familiar comforts of home. Safe travels!
